title: Criminal networks in Southeast Asia flourish in Telegram's 'underground markets': UN
description: Criminal networks in Southeast Asia are using Telegram for large-scale illicit activities, says a UN report. The app allows trading of hacked data and tools for cybercrime. Telegram's boss was charged in France for this. The report highlights how criminals have innovated with new technologies, including malware and deepfake software.
content: Powerful criminal networks in Southeast Asia extensively use the messaging app Telegram which has enabled a fundamental change in the way organised crime can conduct large-scale illicit activity, the United Nations said in a report on Monday.
